content.question: Which of the following claims could most accurately be made about the Black press in the early twentieth century?

choices.label: The Black press focused solely on local news stories due to their community importance.
The Black press expanded throughout the nation and promoted the economic stability of communities.
The Black press focused primarily on racial violence and discrimination to enact change.
The Black press discouraged political protests in print for fear of white retaliation.

content.answer: The Black press expanded throughout the nation and promoted the economic stability of communities.
